page.title: 11IZAAK WALTON, ANGLER
page.content: Izaak Walton, an angling expert, lived from 1593 to 1683. He was born and baptised in Stafford, otherwise nothing is known of his early life. He owned a small business in London and after his retirement Walton lived intermittently on the Halfhead farm estate at Shallowford. Walton bequeathed an estate cottage to Stafford for the benefit of the poor. It is now a museum. Shallowford Brook which runs by the cottage was a favourite angling haunt of Walton. Izaak Walton is best known as the author of The Compleat Angler, an anthology of fishing lore. It includes recipes, legends and poems. The book, first published in 1653, remains popular with anglers to this day.
